intro: Notholcus, commonly known as the goldenrod hawkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that attract a variety of pollinators. Notholcus species are typically found in moist or wetland habitats, often growing in meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. They have basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The genus is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, with some species introduced to other regions.
